fr.sii.ogham.core.builder

Interface TemplateParserBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<TemplateParser>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TemplateBuilder, ThymeleafBuilder

    public interface TemplateParserBuilder
extends Builder<TemplateParser>
    Define a builder for a template engine implementation. It provides general methods for all template engines. It helps to construct the object using a fluent interface.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      • Methods inherited from interface fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.Builder

        build

    • Method Detail

      • withPrefix

        TemplateParserBuilder withPrefix(String prefix)
        Set the prefix for template lookup. This prefix is used for all lookup methods. The aim is to define only the name of the template (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the lookup method easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/resetPassword.html
        So you can set the prefix to /foo/template/ and then reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount.html
        • resetPassword.html
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix for template resolution
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • withSuffix

        TemplateParserBuilder withSuffix(String suffix)
        Set the suffix for template lookup. This suffix is used for all lookup methods. The aim is to define only the name of the template (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the lookup method easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/resetPassword.html
        So you can set the prefix to /foo/template/, the suffix to .html and then reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount
        • resetPassword
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix for template resolution
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • withLookupResolver

        TemplateParserBuilder withLookupResolver(String lookup,
                                         ResourceResolver resolver)
        Register a lookup resolver. The lookup is like JNDI lookup. It indicates using a simple string how to handle the provided path or URL. For example:
        • "classpath:/foo" indicates that the provided path represents a classpath entry.
        • "file:/tmp" indicates that the provided path represents a file located on the system.
        Parameters:
        lookup - the lookup name (without the : character)
        resolver - the resolver implementation
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use
